para: Each &skel; maintains a stack of previous incarnations of itself. Whenever a &skel; is modified, a new version is pushed onto the stack. The Undo pops the latest version off of the stack, thereby reverting to the previous version of the &skel;. The popped version is not destroyed — it can be recovered with the command.
The &skel; stack is not infinite. When it is full, the oldest version of a &skel; will be lost when a new modification is made.
